posts.body:
>>88b546a1-2459-4a7b-be4e-2bf6fedaa1d6
This would also make it sheer impossible for the MSM to spread links to the board. Nobody is going to sit there for five minutes while the host takes a dozen attempts to read a hash.

>>0c1a1191-5046-42ff-895a-382f0484b363
You have to set the permissions in the torrc file. Append this:
ControlPort 9051
CookieAuthentication 1
DataDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
ExtORPortCookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
CacheDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFile /var/lib/tor/control_auth_cookie

Also ensure you run tor as the proper tor user (for me it's tor, may be debian-tor for you, depends on the system)

>>dd657433-fc8b-41ef-905c-ca4ec1d68f8b
Got it running, made the mistake of setting the SocksPort instead of the ControlPort in torrc.

>>8094a369-64b4-461b-9733-069853fa2120
I made the jump too. I hope we got at least a couple people out, that board was comfy.

>>26e2e99e-69cb-4b9d-ad0d-f09bb675d45f
Connect on 43110, then go to ZeroHello (the start page you get to when you click on the "9" in the upper right corner) and there at the top select for tor always on.  
Alternatively go to your zeronet directory and add tor=always in your conf.

>>256d9008-f0d3-4e83-836c-08a8e5efaed7
>series of breadcrumbs leading directly to your dox
Riddle me this: If you always connect through tor, and are never retarded enough to mention anything about your personal life or accounts on other websites, how are they going to dox you?  
Sure, they could connect that you're the guy that said to gas the jews and that had a nice recipe for chilli, but that's hardly dox.

>>2d73417c-9dc4-43f5-824e-79de63054581
Shoulda shilled GNUnet before this kicked off, that's written in God's own C.  

>>5235fba5-acca-4713-8e00-a0bf2bc9c0a3

>>25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1
This thing seems to actually work.  Great, thank you.

>>75492035-8eed-49c3-a5ae-af3e6a489c23
On linux, start ntpd at startup. On Windows, go to your settings, time and date, there set the system time to be synced with an internet source.  

Also, /tech/ has found a way for every user to upgrade their own 08chan experierience to the newer millchan version easily.  instructions are here:  
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

>>a7b4ab4a-f3f6-400f-bb17-4666577defda
I've been reading Tatoeba Last Dungeon Mae no Mura no Shounen ga Joban no Machi de Kurasu Youna Monogatari. It's about a guy who has very little self-esteem because he comes from a village where all the heroes have secluded themselves in the past and so now everyone has eugenic'sd themselves into being able to beat demon lords with a single punch.

>>4c3831cc-70d6-4304-b224-544eda20b364
If you click the "This is my site" in the sidebar, it prevents it from being overwritten.

>>e99eb0ba-63c4-4398-a58f-1626e6983f1d

>>7dfb1597-f36d-4db5-9ed2-faff06265be2
If you block only the board, only all posts from the BO and the posts on the board get blocked.  
If you block every user separately, you don't see them in any other board anymore either.

>>3c46fbef-7b3e-413d-ad63-5e8f65276e10
Not particularly great, like all P2P. 
You need either a critical mass of users or a couple people that activate the "Download and share everything" option for the site.

>>6899d85c-3016-4731-bc48-f493b6ece683
Drag the "0" in the upper right to the left, then set the size limit in the sidebar to at least a couple hundred megabyte and you're going to be in a more realistic situation.

>>af380024-8cce-4b96-adaf-3c499c728db9

>>471b5312-899a-407f-8f6d-2b9357f24f11

Oh noez, our based pig farmer isn't controlling this website, that means we can't trust it

>>ff7aa50f-5ede-4ca0-8736-5c34f1f8c00c
Tor+Full disk encryption=glowniggers can't do shit.

>>c6086478-c55b-46fd-b78f-b9feeb7dd788
Everything that isn't Google, Amazon, or Facebook belongs on a decentralized service sooner or later. The old net is obsolete at this point, the only reason it still exists is pure inertia.

>>0d10b38f-46b5-4844-af1d-1ff6cb3d7e8f
I write gamedocs. Start with describing what you want, then start breaking it down into what systems you'll need to achieve it, then start breaking the system down into functions. You only really need to write down the interfaces that other functions deal with.

>>9d8b652c-39c5-488d-9f29-07f1d0fbfde9

I'll see what I can do, but I'm fairly shit at network stuff.
